1.Plate 20-25x10<sup>6</sup> macrophages in culture flask.


2.Wash the cells and change the media next day.


3.Infect the macrophages with L. major for 6 h.

body: Wash the cells with plain RPMI \(Gibco) to remove parasites that are not internalized.
Where required treat the cells either with β-MCD\(10Mm) for 45 min and/or with cholesterol for 1h in the serum free medium at 37 <sup>0</sup>C.

After treatment or 72 h of infection stimulate the cells where required and then lyse the cells in cold 726 μl of TNE-buffer \(25 mM Tris-HCl pH 7.5, 50 mM NaCl, 5 mM EGTA) containing 1% Triton-X100 supplemented with protease and phosphatase inhibitors for 30 min on ice.
Mix the lysate with 1452 μl of 70% Nycodenz \(Sigma), dissolved in TNE-buffer.
Load this mix in the bottom of 4 ml of polyallomar ultracentrifuge tube.
Overlay this bottom loaded mix with 25, 21.5, 18, 15, and 8% Nycodenz, prepared in TNE-buffer.
Spin the tube at 200,000 × g for 4 h at 40C using SW 60 Ti rotor \(Beckman Coulter).
After centrifugation collect eleven fractions \(Fr.) each of 364 μl from top to bottom of the tube.
Analyse the fraction by SDS-PAGE and immunoblot.
Probe the blot with caveolin-1 antibody to confirm cav-1 positive \(Fr.2-Fr.5) or detergent resistant membrane fractions \(DRMs).
Probe the blot with anti-β-coat protein or anti-CD71 to confirm soluble \(Fr.7-Fr.11) fractions.
